intro: Argyreia laotica, commonly known as the Laos morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a climbing vine, featuring heart-shaped leaves and tendrils that aid in its ascent. Its flowers open in the morning and close at night, hence the common name. Argyreia laotica is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine in some regions.
